Another focus area is the use of angiotensin (1–7) as a novel treatment for COVID-19.
26 Experimental studies found that angiotensin (1–7) reduced the acute inflammatory response and subsequent fibrosis in acid-induced ARDS in mice.
62 Angiotensin (1–7) protected the lung against inflammation and fibrosis, inhibited alveolar cell apoptosis, attenuated endothelial cell activation, loss of barrier function and oedema, and decreased synthesis of pro-inflammatory and pro-fibrotic cytokines. The authors therefore recommended that the concentrations of angiotensin (1–7) should be increased to protect COVID-19-infected patients.
